results.title: Metal cutting tools: rake and clearance angles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
A demonstration of the correct usage of cutting tools. Angles required for clearance to avoid rubbing, chatter and vibration are shown in detail. Rake angles used for drilling different types of metals are also demonstrated.

results.title: Manufacture of carbon steel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
Opens with an explanation of the differences between high carbon, medium carbon, and mild steels. The main part of the film describes various stages in the manufacture of steel.

results.title: Hard soldering
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
The three forms in which spelter is available; wire, strip and grain. Brazing the joints on a toasting fork. Uses of borax flux, wet and dry. Close-up shots of the brazing hearth. The heating up technique. Quenching, pickling, and cleaning up. Jointing two pipes into a T-piece. Wiring them into position. Seaming the joint on a square pipe.
results.description:

results.title: Beaten metalwork, seaming: making a child's mug
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
This film shows the making of a child’s mug right through from the sheet metal to the finished article and gives an opportunity for a number of craft operations to be observed; the design on paper, transference to metal sheet decoration, stages in forming the body of the mug, by bending, seaming, beating, and planishing. The base and the handle are seen being fashioned and joined to the body by brazing. Finally the cleaning up and polishing are shown.
results.title_for_label: Beaten metalwork, seaming: making a child’s mug
results.description:

The base and the handle are seen being fashioned and joined to the body by brazing. Finally the cleaning up and polishing are shown.

results.title: The Milling machine
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education and DCA Educational Products
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Machines”.
Didactic film illustrating the various parts of the vertical and horizontal milling machines. Shows nomenclature of vertical and horizontal milling machines; similarities and differences of vertical and horizontal milling machines; and use of the power feed. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Food from the sun
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Uses demonstrations and animated drawings to show how all life on earth relies on the sun for energy. Explains the process of photosynthesis. Suitable for middle primary level.

results.title: Your body and its parts
results.creator_credit: David Bennett and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Provides an overview of human physiology. Illustrates the body parts working together to do a job and forming a system. Introduces the muscular, respiratory, circulatory, skeletal and nervous systems.
